title.narrative: SL Bumbuna Hydroelectric Environmental and Social Management project

description.narrative: To assist the recipient in satisfactorily addressing and mitigating the environmental and social impacts in the Project Area associated with the completion and initial operation of the Bumbuna hydroelectric dam and transmission line.

condition.narrative: Appraise, approve, and monitor the Community Subprojects, and administer Community Grants, in accordance with provisions + proc.set forth in Section H of Schedule 2 to the DA and PIM and ESMP
Carry out the Project in accordance with the Communication Action Plan
Cause the Bumbuna dam and transmission line operation, maintenance and management contractors to develop and implementenvironmental and social management plans consistent with the ESMP
Comply with the disbursement procedures and instructions specified in the Disbursement Letter and Disbursement Guidelines referredto in the FA.
Contract NGO(s) for independent monitoring of the activities (resettlement process, legal aid to Affected Persons, carry out LAIRProgram)
Ensure that the Credit proceeds are used to finance eligible expenditures, in accordance with the FA disbursement table
Ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Anti-Corruption Guidelines
Ensure that the establishment and operation of the Loma mountains national park is carried out in accordance with the guidelines,procedures, measures set forth in the Loma Mount. Process Framework
Establish and maintain a financial management system, including records & accounts & prepare financial statements
Furnish IDA with quarterly IFRs
Furnish certified copies of audited financial statements to IDA, with auditor's opinion
Implement (or cause the dam and transmission line operation, maintenance and management contractors to implement) the Project inaccordance with the Environmental and Social Management Plan.
Legally establish and thereafter ensure the efficient operation of the Bumbuna Trust.
Legally establish in a manner satisfactory to IDA, and thereafter ensure the efficient maintenance and functioning of, a nationalpark in Loma mountains as an environmental offset.
Maintain Bumbuna Watershed Management Authority w/ mandate, functions, staffing and resources satisfactory to IDA
Maintain PMU in MOEWR w/ mandate, TORs, staffing and resources satisfactory to IDA
Maintain the DSRP, and promptly provide to IDA a copy of each report prepared by the DSRP, and make such report publicly available
Maintain the ESAP and promptly provide to IDA a copy of each report prepared by the ESAP, and make such reports publicly available.
Prepare, and implement the Emergency Preparedness Plan, and ensure that the dam safety measures recommended by the DSRP for thenear zone area are implemented prior to post-commissioning mission
Prepare, and thereafter implement a consolidated Bumbuna Watershed Management Plan, including the operation of the BumbunaConservation Area, in a manner satisfactory to IDA
Procure all goods, works and services in accordance with the procurement requirements and procedures specified in the FA, theProcurement/Consultant Guidelines and the Procurement Plan
Project Monitoring in accordance with the agreed key performance indicators, and submit & review w/ IDA semi-annual progress reports
Project implemented in accordance with guidelines, procedures, timetable and specifications set forth in the Dam and ReservoirResettle. Action Plan and the Transmission Line Resett. Plan
Revise and update the Project Implementation Manual in a manner satisfactory to IDA; and thereafter carry out the Project inaccordance with the PIM as approved by IDA.
Set aside adequate resources (including a portion of the electricity tariff) for the sustainable financing of the Bumbuna Trust,ina manner acceptable to IDA
